body_html:
If you just want to run a particular group of tests, you can filter by regex on the names by using something like pytest (to run all tests that have "loss" in their names, pytest test/test_jit.py -v -k "loss")

But yeah, splitting it this way makes sense.
body_text:
If you just want to run a particular group of tests, you can filter by regex on the names by using something like pytest (to run all tests that have "loss" in their names, pytest test/test_jit.py -v -k "loss")
But yeah, splitting it this way makes sense.
body:
If you just want to run a particular group of tests, you can filter by regex on the names by using something like pytest (to run all tests that have "loss" in their names, pytest test/test_jit.py -v -k "loss")

But yeah, splitting it this way makes sense.
